638:
STUN server is used by the service transmission of audio and video.

Also it is designed to " punch "NAT, which can be located between users, if turned off - will be used public STUN server
640: Description: TCP port of built-in WEB server, which is designed for web chat (Web'o'Chat) and Remote Management Console (you are now in it). If you change the port, you must restart the web server.
642: Description: These two pairs of addresses and ports are required for the STUN server. The ports must be different, as they are generated from the four pairs: IP1: port1 , IP1: port2 , IP2: port1 , IP2: port2 . With the help of these 4 pairs STUN server explains to clients how they interact with each other.
643: Description: IP address of the FTP server for clients who connect from the outside (the Internet or other networks), if the MyChat server is in the DMZ or behind the NAT. Leave it empty, if the server is running in the local network with no external clients.

Variables for inserting into an email:

%INVITE% — invitation link. Usage example: <a href="%INVITE%">Invitation into a private chat</a>
%INVITECODE% — invitation code. Usage example: <a href="http://mysite.com/%INVITECODE%">Invitation into a private chat</a>.
%USERNAME% — the name of the inviting person.
%COMMENT% — invitation comment.
%EXPIRED% — invitation validity.
%SENDERNAME% — sender name.
%SENDERWORKPHONE% — sender's office tel number.
%SENDERCELLULARPHONE% — sender's mobile number.
%SENDERCOMPANYNAME% — sender's company name.
%SENDERWORKPOSITION% — sender's position.
%SENDERWORKDEPARTMENT% — sender's division.

1773:
The users moving tool from one server to another. It used when you re-install server onto another address/port and users must be reconnected automatically to a new server address. When you will send a new connections parameters, the client will overwrited them instead old server connection settings.

While the client is online you can send a new connection parameters as many times as you want.

Be careful!If you send wrong data, so after the clients disconnection, you will not be able to send them correct connection settings.

Constants list:
%uin% - user UIN;
%firstname% - name;
%middlename% - surname;
%lastname% - last name;
%nick% - nickname;
%email% - main email address;
%homecellular% - personal mobile number;
%homephone% - home tel number;
%workcompanyname% - company name;
%workposition% - position;
%workdivdept% - division name, where the person works;
%workphone% - office tel number;
%firstname.% - user name, shrank up to one capital letter with a dot;
%middlename.% - user's middle name, shrank up to one capital letter with a dot;
%lastname.% - last name, shrank up to one capital letter with a dot;
%nick.% - user's nickname, shrank up to one capital letter with a dot;
%custom1% — user defined value, text string from the user's profile №1;
%custom2% — user defined value, text string from the user's profile №2;
%custom3% — user defined value, text string from the user's profile №3.
